meanings.definition: The smallest structural and functional unit of an organism.
meanings.sent1: Our bodies are made up of tiny cells that work together to keep us healthy.
meanings.sent2: Under the microscope, you can see the cells that make up plants and animals.
meanings.sent3: The cells in our body must be having a party, they never seem to stop moving!
meanings.sent4: Just like a city, our body is a bustling metropolis of cells, each with its own job to do.
meanings.sent5: In a single drop of blood, there are millions of cells, each with a specific role to play.

meanings.definition: A small room in a prison or monastery.
meanings.sent1: The prisoner spent hours pacing back and forth in his cramped cell.
meanings.sent2: The monk found solace in the quiet of his monastery cell.
meanings.sent3: The cell in the old prison was so small, it felt like a closet!
meanings.sent4: Locked in his cell, the inmate felt the weight of his confinement.
meanings.sent5: The monk's cell was sparse, with only a bed and a small desk for meditation.

meanings.definition: A device containing electrodes immersed in an electrolyte, used for generating electricity.
meanings.sent1: The scientist carefully examined the fuel cell to ensure it was functioning properly.
meanings.sent2: The battery in your phone is made up of tiny cells that store and release energy.
meanings.sent3: The electric car's cells were charged up and ready to go for a long drive.
meanings.sent4: The solar panel converts sunlight into electricity through its photovoltaic cells.
meanings.sent5: Each cell in the power grid plays a crucial role in supplying electricity to homes and businesses.
